page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: Westbury is in Buckinghamshire which has selection whereas neighbours Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire have a comprehensive system.This choice has an effect on the numbers and movements of children from the village school. In 1962 the new school built on what had been Manor gardens had 80 pupils in 4 classes (similar to its predecessor the National school which in 1893 had 84 ageing from 3 to 11 in one class.)Then it was decided to develop Middle schools in Buckingham 5 miles away so at 9 children transfer to Page Hill for 3 years.After a "12+" exam they go to either the Royal Latin or Buckingham Secondary. Now with the falling rural population and easier transport there are only 20 pupils at the village school and it is back to its original one teacher for all ages.
